#Why Vote for Elizabeth Warren

**TL;DR: Everyone has different reasons, but highlights include that Elizabeth:**

- **Fights hard for us as a Senator**
- **Refuses dirty moneyâ€”no donations from PACs, lobbyists, etc**
- **Has a plan for that**


Elizabeth's supporters come from many different backgrounds and walks of life, and each has their own personal reasons for supporting her campaign. Many of our subredditors have crafted thoughtful responses to other posts, so please check out:

- This phenomenal post: [The Case for Warren from the Left](https://www.reddit.com/r/ElizabethWarren/comments/cjcguc/the_case_for_warren_from_the_left/)
- [Many other replies](https://www.reddit.com/r/ElizabethWarren/search/?q=flair%3A%22Why%20Warren%22&restrict_sr=1) to people asking why folks so strongly support Warren

See if any of them speak to you!

Below are some of the main reasons people support Warren. Hopefully you'll find something you like!

##She Fights Hard for You

Elizabeth was instrumental in the creation of the [Consumer Financial Protection Bureau](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/economy/making-sense/what-is-the-consumer-financial-protection-bureau-anyway), which was formed in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis to protect the financial interests of working Americans against the predation of big capital. After Wall Street's heavy opposition led Republicans to block her confirmation to the Bureau she helped create, she decided to run for Senate to fight entrenched corporate interests. As a member of the Senate Banking Committee, she continues to hold big capital accountable for its actions and defend the financial rights of every American. Elizabeth pushed for the enforcement of Dodd-Frank regulations and the criminal prosecution of executives at big banks who abuse their positions by [ending the Too Big To Jail Act](https://www.warren.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/2019.4.2%20Ending%20Too%20Big%20to%20Jail%20Summary.pdf) and introducing the [Corporate Executive Accountability Act](https://www.warren.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/2019.4.1%20Corporate%20Executive%20Accountability%20Act%20Summary.pdf).

##She Refuses Dirty Money

Elizabeth's campaign is heavily funded by small donors like yourself. She has refused to take any money from PACs or registered lobbyists and has turned away from holding fundraising events for big money donors, preferring to build a true grassroots movement which leaves her unbeholden to interests other than those of the American public. She has pledged [not to take large donations](https://medium.com/@teamwarren/my-plan-for-getting-big-money-out-of-politics-9819aec4240c) from executives at big tech companies, banks, equity firms, or hedge funds. This focus on small donors has been massively successful: she raised [almost $25 million](https://medium.com/@teamwarren/an-update-on-our-q3-fundraising-numbers-4b290e7e9d80) in the third quarter of 2019 alone, and none of it money from any special interests.

##She Has a Plan for That

Elizabeth has the most comprehensive, exhaustively researched, and well-defended set of policy plans of any of the candidatesâ€” if you're worried about it, she probably has a plan for it.
